constructor.description: Creates a new connection to the given database (file). If the given database does not yet exist, it is created for you when you try to open it. The resulting connection object is the only way you interact with the database.

parameter.name: connectionParams
parameter.description:
A hashmap of parameters for connecting to the database. Required properties are:
  • PATH (the path to the database file).
Optional parameters are:
  • CLOSE_AFTER_EXECUTE (whether to close the connection after each call to execute, default is false), and
  • CLOSE_AFTER_REQUEST (whether to close the connection after each request, default is true).

return-type.description: Returns an instance of Connection.

property.name: implementation
property.description: Returns the string identifying the database implementation of this connection. You can compare this e.g. to Jaxer.DB.SQLite.IMPLEMENTATION or Jaxer.DB.MySQL.IMPLEMENTATION

property.name: isOpen
property.description: Is the connection currently open? Recall that even if the answer is no the connection would automatically be opened when needed.

property.name: lastInsertId
property.description: Returns the unique "rowid" of the most recent successful INSERT command on the current connection. If the table has a column of type INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, this is used as the rowid. If no successful INSERTs have ever occurred on this connection, 0 is returned. Note that unsuccessful INSERTs do not change this value. This is a synonym for lastInsertRowId. See http://www.sqlite.org/c3ref/last_insert_rowid.html for more details.

property.name: lastInsertRowId
property.description: Returns the unique "rowid" of the most recent successful INSERT command on the current connection. If the table has a column of type INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, this is used as the rowid. If no successful INSERTs have ever occurred on this connection, 0 is returned. Note that unsuccessful INSERTs do not change this value. This is a synonym for lastInsertId. See http://www.sqlite.org/c3ref/last_insert_rowid.html for more details.

property.name: version
property.description: Returns the string identifying the version of the database to which you are connected.

method.name: close
method.description: Closes the connection if it's open. This is optional, and only does something if the connection is open.

method.name: execute
method.description: Executes the given sql using the connection. If the SQL includes ?'s (question marks) as parameter placeholders, the values of those parameters should be passed in as extra arguments to this function, either as individual arguments or as a single array. If the last argument is a (non-Array) object, it is used to pass in options. Currently two options are supported: dateHandler and useLocalTimezone. If dateHandler is given, it should be a function that takes the raw MySQL date/time/datetime string representation of a returned cell value, and a string describing the declared type, and returns the desired JavaScript representation. If dateHandler is not given, set useLocalTimezone to true to store date/time values using the local timezone. Otherwise, by default they are stored as UTC.

examples.example:
rs = conn.execute("SELECT * FROM myTable");
			rs = conn.execute("SELECT * FROM myTable WHERE id=? AND zip=?", myId, myZip);
			rs = conn.execute("SELECT * FROM myTable WHERE id=? AND zip=?", [myId, myZip]);

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The sql statement to be executed as a prepared statement

return-type.description: The results of the query. For a SELECT-type query, a Jaxer.DB.ResultSet is returned, with 0 or more rows. For an INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE-type query, the number of rows affected is returned.
The results of the query. For a SELECT-type query, a Jaxer.DB.ResultSet is returned, with 0 or more rows. For an INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE-type query, the number of rows affected is returned.
The results of the query. For a SELECT-type query, a Jaxer.DB.ResultSet is returned, with 0 or more rows. For an INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE-type query, the number of rows affected is returned.

method.name: getLastInsertRowId
method.description: Returns the unique "rowid" of the most recent successful INSERT command on the current connection. If the table has a column of type INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, this is used as the rowid. If no successful INSERTs have ever occurred on this connection, 0 is returned. Note that unsuccessful INSERTs do not change this value. This is the same as asking for the lastInsertRowId or lastInsertId properties. See http://www.sqlite.org/c3ref/last_insert_rowid.html for more details.

return-type.description: The rowid, or 0

method.name: mapExecute
method.description: Prepares the given SQL query string on the current default database (as defined in configApps.js) and then iteratively executes it over the given array of parameters.

examples.example:
[rsA, rsB] = conn.mapExecute("SELECT * FROM myTable WHERE id=?", [idA, idB]);
			[rsA, rsB] = conn.mapExecute("SELECT * FROM myTable WHERE id=? AND zip=?", [ [idA, zipA], [idB, zipB] ]);

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The SQL to execute, using ?'s (question marks) as parameter placeholders

parameter.name: arrayOfParameters
parameter.description: An array of parameters to use for each execution. Each element of the array may itself be a single value or an array of values (corresponding to the ?'s in the SQL)

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: An optional hashmap of options. Currently three options are supported: flatten, dateHandler, and useLocalTimezone. If flatten is true, the returned result will be a single ResultSet with its rows being the concatenated rows of each query. If dateHandler is given, it should be a function that takes the raw MySQL date/time/datetime string representation of a returned cell value, and a string describing the declared type, and returns the desired JavaScript representation. If dateHandler is not given, set useLocalTimezone to true to store date/time values using the local timezone. Otherwise, by default they are stored as UTC.

return-type.description: A corresponding array of Jaxer.DB.ResultSets or Numbers for each query, or a combined Jaxer.DB.ResultSet or Number if the 'flatten' option is true. For SELECT-type queries one or more Jaxer.DB.ResultSets are returned; for INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE-type queries the number of affected rows is returned.

method.name: open
method.description: Opens the connection so queries can be executed. This is optional, since if the connection is not open when it's asked to execute some SQL, it will open the connection automatically. Also closing the connection is optional.

method.name: test
method.description: Tests the connection by trying to connect and catching and returning any error encountered. If the connection is successful, returns a null.

parameter.name: keepOpen
parameter.description: If true, the connection will be kept open (if the test was successful). If false, the connection will be left in the same state as before the test: if it was open before it will be kept open, otherwise it will be closed.

return-type.description: If successful, returns null; if unsuccessful, returns the error. Usually you can use the error's sqlErrorCode and sqlErrorDescription to see what the error was (or just its toString() method).

class.description: A database-based persistor for Jaxer Container objects (session, sessionPage, etc.)

constructor.description:
A database-based persistor for Jaxer Container objects (session, sessionPage, etc.)

(Advanced)

return-type.description: Returns an instance of DBPersistor.

method.name: load
method.description:
Retrieve a given container type's and name's property, by name

(Advanced)

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of the container

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key for the specific instance of the container (e.g. the sessionPage ontainer is per page, and the page's key is used here)

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the property to query for

return-type.description: The value of the (usually serialized) requested property, or the empty string if there is none

method.name: loadAll
method.description:
Load all the name-value properties at once for the given container type and key

(Advanced)

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of the container

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key for the specific instance of the container (e.g. the sessionPage container is per page, and the page's key is used here)

return-type.description: A hashmap of name-value pairs; the values are usually serialized and need to be deserialized via Serialization.fromJSONString

method.name: persist
method.description:
Persist a particular property (by name) for the given container type and key

(Advanced)

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of the container

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key for the specific instance of the container (e.g. the sessionPage container is per page, and the page's key is used here)

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the property to persist

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: The value to persist for this property, which should have already been serialized (using Serialization.toJSONString)

method.name: remove
method.description:
Completely remove the given property from the database

(Advanced)

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of the container

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key for the specific instance of the container (e.g. the sessionPage container is per page, and the page's key is used here)

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the property to remove

method.name: removeAll
method.description:
Completely remove all the container's properties from the database

(Advanced)

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of the container

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key for the specific instance of the container (e.g. the sessionPage container is per page, and the page's key is used here)

method.name: createSchema
method.description:
Creates the database schema needed to persist containers

(Advanced)

class.description: Utility object for filesystem directory access.

constructor.description: Creates a new Directory handle for performing filesystem directory operations.

parameter.name: aPath
parameter.description: a java style path object where double backslash is used as a folder hierarchy delimiter

return-type.description: a Dir object reference initialized to the provided path.

exception.description: Throws an exception containing the error code.

method.name: clone
method.description: Clone a directory object

return-type.description: an new Dir Object cloned from the original

exception.description: Throws an Exception containing the error code.

method.name: contains
method.description: Tests whether a file Object exists in the Physical directory referenced by the Dir object

parameter.name: aFileObj
parameter.description: the aFileObj parameter may be either a JSLib file object or a string containing the name of the object.

return-type.description: True/False indicates whether the file was found;

exception.description: Throws an Exception containing the error code.

method.name: create
method.description: Creates a new folder under the referenced path of the directory object The format of the permissions is a unix style numeric chmod i.e. 0777 or 444 on Windows, you can only set the Read/Write bits of a file. And User/Group/Other will have the SAME settings based on the most-relaxed setting (Read 04, 040, 0400, Write 02, 020, 0200). When a file is created, by default it has both Read and Write permissions. Also, you cannot set the file permission to WRITE-ONLY, doing so would set it to read-write

parameter.name: aPermissions
parameter.description: The permissions used to create the filesystem object.

exception.description: Throws a Exception containing the error code if filesytem object is unable to be created.

method.name: createHierarchy
method.description: Creates a hierarchy of folders as needed to contain the current folder's path. The format of the permissions is the same as for the create method.

parameter.name: aPermissions
parameter.description: The permissions used to create al the filesystem objects

exception.description: Throws a Exception containing the error code if any filesytem object is unable to be created.

method.name: createUnique
method.description: Create a new unique folder under the referenced path of the directory object The format of the permissions is a unix style numeric chmod i.e. 0777 or 444 on Windows, you can only set the Read/Write bits of a file. And User/Group/Other will have the SAME settings based on the most-relaxed setting (Read 04, 040, 0400, Write 02, 020, 0200). When a file is created, by default it has both Read and Write permissions. Also, you cannot set the file permission to WRITE-ONLY, doing so would set it to read-write

parameter.name: aPermissions
parameter.description: The permissions used to create the filesystem object, this may be ignored by some versions of windows.

exception.description: Throws an Exception containing the error code.

method.name: readDir
method.description: Read the contents of a directory

return-type.description: an Array of Filesystem Objects, with no sort order explicitly set.

exception.description: Throws an Exception containing the error code.

method.name: remove
method.description: Removes specified folder from the file system

parameter.name: aRecursive
parameter.description: True/False value to indicate whether the removal includes subfolders.

exception.description: Throws a Exception containing the error code.

method.name: combine
method.description: Combines any number of path fragments into a single path, using the current operating system's filesystem path separator. Before joining two fragments with the path separator, it strips any existing path separators on the fragment ends to be joined

parameter.description: Takes any number of string path fragments

return-type.description: The fragments joined into a path

method.name: create
method.description: Creates a new folder (directory) at the specified path and returns it The format of the permissions is a unix style numeric chmod i.e. 0777 or 444 on Windows, you can only set the Read/Write bits of a file. And User/Group/Other will have the SAME settings based on the most-relaxed setting (Read 04, 040, 0400, Write 02, 020, 0200). When a file is created, by default it has both Read and Write permissions. Also, you cannot set the file permission to WRITE-ONLY, doing so would set it to read-write

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The path of the new folder

parameter.name: aPermissions
parameter.description: The permissions used to create the filesystem object.

return-type.description: The new directory object

exception.description: Throws a Exception containing the error code if filesytem object is unable to be created.

method.name: createHierarchy
method.description: Creates a hierarchy of folders as needed to contain the current folder's path. The format of the permissions is the same as for the create method.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The path of the new folder

parameter.name: aPermissions
parameter.description: The permissions used to create all the filesystem objects

return-type.description: The new directory object

exception.description: Throws a Exception containing the error code if filesytem object is unable to be created.

method.name: exists
method.description: Does the directory exist on disk?

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The full or partial (to be resolved) path to test

return-type.description: true if exists, false otherwise

method.name: grep
method.description:
Scan a folder tree from the provided path and find files that match the provided regular expression pattern. The available options properties are
  • pattern : a string containing a regular expression e.g. "^.*\.js$"
  • flags : the flags to use with the regular expression, e.g. "i" to ignore case
  • recursive: true/false indication of whether to search sub folders for the match

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The starting path for the search. This must be a folder.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: Optional An Associative Array of optional parameters

return-type.description: An Array of Jaxer.File objects that matched the provided pattern

exception.description: A Jaxer.Exception object is thrown when the path is not a valid folder

method.name: map
method.description: Scan a folder tree from the provided path and find files that match the provided regular expression pattern and run the provided function against each match

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The starting path for the search. This must be a folder.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: Optional An Associative Array of optional parameters

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: Optional The function to run. It will be invoked for each the matched Jaxer.File object, with the Jaxer.File object being passed as its parameter

return-type.description: An Array of objects created by invoking the provided function on each file which matched the provided pattern

exception.description: A Jaxer.Exception object is thrown when the path is not a valid folder

method.name: pathToUrl
method.description: Convert a native filesystem path to a URL format, which will begin with "file:...".

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The full path to be converted

return-type.description: The URL, or null if the path could not be converted
The URL, or null if the path could not be converted

method.name: resolve
method.description: Resolves a path to an absolute path on the filesystem, using as a reference (base) the given path or the current page's path.

parameter.name: pathToResolve
parameter.description: The path to resolve, e.g. a filename. It can also be a resource pattern (e.g. "resource:///...") or a file pattern (e.g. "file:///...")

parameter.name: referencePath
parameter.description: An optional path to use as a reference. By default, it uses the current page's path.

return-type.description: The full path on the filesystem

method.name: urlToPath
method.description: Convert a URL in string format to a native filesystem path. The URL must begin with "file:..."

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: The URL to convert

return-type.description: The full path, or null if the URL could not be converted
The full path, or null if the URL could not be converted

class.description: This is a utility class that wraps XPCOM directory/folder utility functions

constructor.description: Directory Utility helper object

return-type.description: Returns an instance of DirUtils.

property.name: current

class.description: A container for all the loaded extensions to the Jaxer framework.
Utility object for simple filesystem access.

examples.example:
var p = '/tmp/foo.dat';
	 var f = new Jaxer.File(p);

constructor.description: Creates a new File handle for performing filesystem file operations.

parameter.name: aPath
parameter.description: an argument of string local file path

return-type.description: Returns an instance of File.

exception.description: Throws a Exception containing the error code upon failure.

property.name: EOF
property.description: Checks 'end of file' status and returns boolean to indicate whether the end of file has been reached. This function takes no arguments but needs an open read mode filehandle.

examples.example:
var p='/tmp/foo.dat';
	 var f=new Jaxer.File(p);
	 f.open();
	 while(!f.EOF)
		 dump("line: "+f.readline()+"\n");

property.name: ext
property.description: Returns the extension of the file object

examples.example:
var p='/tmp/foo.dat';
	 var f=new Jaxer.File(p);
	 alert(f.ext);
outputs: dat

property.name: pos
property.description: Returns the current byte position in the referenced file. This method is only applicable when using the File.read() method. If used with the File.readline() method it will return the internal read ahead buffer position, which is unlikely to be what was expected.

examples.example:
var p='/tmp/foo.dat';
	 var f=new Jaxer.File(p);
	 f.open();
	 while(!f.EOF){
		 dump("pos: "+f.pos+"\n");
		 dump("line: "+f.readline()+"\n");
	 }

property.name: size
property.description: Returns the size in bytes of the referenced file system object as reported by the OS.

examples.example:
var p='/tmp/foo.dat';
	 var f=new Jaxer.File(p);
	 f.size;
outputs: int 16

method.name: clone

method.name: close

	 var f=new Jaxer.File(p);
	 f.open();

parameter.name: exception

method.name: open
method.description: Opens the file for reading or writing. The provided file mode can be one or two characters the using 'rb','ab','wb' will cause the file to be opened in binary safe mode. NOTE: This implementation doesn't support file locking so will allow multiple open handles to the same file.

examples.example:
var p='/tmp/foo.dat';
	 var f=new Jaxer.File(p);
	 f.open();

parameter.name: aMode
parameter.description: an argument of string 'w', 'a', 'r', 'b'

parameter.name: aPermissions
parameter.description: a number containing the unix style chmod value for the permissions

exception.description: Throws a Exception containing the error code.

method.name: read
method.description: Reads a file (that's already been opened) and returns its contents. Returns a null on failure.

examples.example:
var p='/tmp/foo.dat';
	 var f=new Jaxer.File(p);
	 f.open();
	 myContent = f.read();
	 f.close();

parameter.name: aSize
parameter.description: optional: the number of bytes to read from the file. If it is omitted the read will return the entire contents of the file.

return-type.description: If the file is text-based, returns the contents as a string; if it's binary, returns it as an Array of bytes (numbers between 0 and 255).
If the file is text-based, returns the contents as a string; if it's binary, returns it as an Array of bytes (numbers between 0 and 255).

exception.description: Throws a Exception containing the error code.

method.name: readAllLines
method.description: Returns an array of individual lines read from the file on success, throws an Exception on failure

examples.example:
var p='/tmp/foo.dat';
	 var f=new Jaxer.File(p);
	 var lines = f.readAllLines();

return-type.description: <string array of foo.dat>

exception.description: Throws a Exception containing the error code.

method.name: readline
method.description: Reads a single line from an open file, takes no arguments but needs an open read mode filehandle returns string containing the data read on success, null on failure

examples.example:
var p='/tmp/foo.dat';
	 var f=new Jaxer.File(p);

		 dump("line: "+f.readline()+"\n");

return-type.description: <string line of foo.dat>

exception.description: Throws a Exception containing the error code.

method.name: chmod
method.description: Get/Set the file permissions for the File object If the optional permissions parameter is provided chmod will set the permissions of the object to those provided. this may be ignored/misreported by some versions of windows. on Windows, you can only set the Read/Write bits of a file. And User/Group/Other will have the SAME settings based on the most-relaxed setting (Read 04, 040, 0400, Write 02, 020, 0200). When a file is created, by default it has both Read and Write permissions. Also, you cannot set the file permission to WRITE-ONLY, doing so would set it to read-write

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The full or partial (to be resolved) path of the original file

parameter.name: permissions
parameter.description: The file permissions to apply to the file referenced by the provided path, this number is an OCTAL representation of the permissions. to indicate a number is in octal format in javascript the first digit must be a 0

return-type.description: The file permissions from the file referenced by the provided path

class.description: Encapsulates function information needed for generating client-side proxies and for server-side storage of functions used in callbacks.

constructor.description: This class encapsulates function information needed for generating client-side proxies and for server-side storage of functions used in callbacks.

parameter.name: functionName
parameter.description: This parameter is the name of the function this info represents.

parameter.name: parameterNames
parameter.description: This parameter is an array of parameter names for the function this info represents.

parameter.name: source
parameter.description: This parameter is the actual source code of the function this info represents.

return-type.description: Returns an instance of FunctionInfo.

constructor.description:
This class encapsulates function information needed for generating client-side proxies and for server-side storage of functions used in callbacks.

(Advanced)

parameter.name: functionReference
parameter.description: This is a reference to the actual Javascript function instance this info represents.

parameter.name: functionNode
parameter.description: This is an optional parameter that is the root node of an AST representing the function this info represents.

return-type.description: Returns an instance of FunctionInfo.

method.name: createClientSource
method.description:
Create a string representation of the underlying function to be used client-side as the source of this function.

(Advanced)

return-type.description: Returns a string representation of this function info's underlying Javascript function in a form needed to execute the function on the client

method.name: createServerFunction
method.description:
Create a string representation of the underlying function to be used during a callback. This source will be stored in the callback database and will be used to reconstitute the function during a callback. This is used for cached and proxied functions.

(Advanced)

parameter.name: namespace
parameter.description: If specified, the function is specified as a property on the given namespace object. Otherwise, the function is specified as a global property.

parameter.name: proxied
parameter.description: If specified and true, the function will have a property called "proxy" and set to true.

parameter.name: noLocalScope
parameter.description: If specified and true, the function will NOT be assigned to a global property with its name. That is, this.<name> will NOT be created.

return-type.description: Returns a string representation of this function info's underlying Javascript function in a form needed to execute the function on the server.

method.name: isNative
method.description:
Is the underlying function a native one (for which no actual source is available)?

(Advanced)

class.description: Namespace object holding functions and members used to get and include HTML and JavaScript from external sources.

method.name: compile
method.description:
Compile the given JavaScript string in the given global context

(Advanced)

parameter.name: contents
parameter.description: The string of script code to compile

parameter.name: global
parameter.description: An optional global context (usually a window object) in which to compile it

parameter.name: effectiveUrl
parameter.description: An optional parameter to indicate (e.g. in error messages) the effective URL from which this code originates.

return-type.description: The compiled bytecode, as a string.

method.name: evalCompiledOn
method.description:
Evaluate the given JavaScript bytecode string in the given global context

(Advanced)

parameter.name: contents
parameter.description: The string of script code to evaluate

parameter.name: global
parameter.description: An optional global context (usually a window object) in which to evaluate it

return-type.description: The result of the last JavaScript expression evaluated.

method.name: evalOn
method.description:
Evaluate the given JavaScript string in the given global context

(Advanced)

parameter.name: contents
parameter.description: The string of script code to evaluate

parameter.name: global
parameter.description: An optional global context (usually a window object) in which to evaluate it

parameter.name: effectiveUrl
parameter.description: An optional parameter to indicate (e.g. in error messages) the effective URL from which this code originates.

return-type.description: The result of the last JavaScript expression evaluated.

method.name: load
method.description: Loads and evaluates a JavaScript file on the given global execution object with the given runat attribute.

parameter.name: src
parameter.description: The URL from which the JavaScript file should be retrieved. If the src is an absolute file://... URL then it is retrieved directly from the file system, otherwise it is retrieved via a web request.

parameter.name: global
parameter.description: The global (usually a window object) on which to evaluate it. By default, it is the same global as the one in which the calling function is executing.

parameter.name: runat
parameter.description: The value of the effective runat "attribute" to use when evaluating this code. By default, it uses the same runat attribute as the last evaluated script block.

parameter.name: useCache
parameter.description: If true, the file is loaded from a cached compiled version if available, and if not available the file's contents are fetched, compiled and cached. By default this is false.

parameter.name: forceCacheRefresh
parameter.description: If true, force loading from src even if found in cache. The loaded contents will then be cached. By default this is false.

parameter.name: dontSetRunat
parameter.description: If true, any functions created in this script block will not have a runat property set on them, not even the default runat of the last script block. By default this is false.

return-type.description: The result of the last JavaScript expression evaluated, if any.

class.description: Log is a static object meant to be shared across the framework and perhaps even the user's code. In a module, use it to create a module-specific logger and then log with it.

examples.example: To log without a module name, use Jaxer.Log.info("my message"), where instead of info you can use any of the six logging levels: trace(...), debug(...), info(...), warn(...), error(...), and fatal(...). The generic logger is set by default to only log messages at or above the info level.

To log with a module name, first define a log helper: var log = Jaxer.Log.forModule("myModule"); This will get or create the module logger with this name. Then use log.info(...) or any of the other methods.
The default level of messages to log is set in configLog.js (default and local) and can also be changed in memory:

method.description:
Alters the built-in setter methods for various DOM FORM element prototypes to alter the DOM as well as set the value of the associated in-memory property. E.g., normally when you set the value of an input element, the "value" attribute of the element in the DOM isn't altered. After running the function below, the "value" attribute on any input element will stay in sync with its in-memory value, so it will get serialized with the rest of the DOM when we're ready to send the DOM to the browser.

class.description: Used to execute operating system processes

constructor.description: The constructor for an object that wraps an operating system process. This also provides static functions for more easily executing operating system processes.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The absolute path to the executable file to execute. This must be specified before execution begins.

parameter.name: async
parameter.description: By default, the process executes synchronously: it blocks until complete. If async is true, it will execute asynchronously, not blocking before completion. This can be specified at any time until execution begins.

return-type.description: The wrapper around the operating system process

property.name: _proc
property.description:
The internal process handle

(Advanced)

property.name: _status
property.description:
The internal status (state) of the process: one of Jaxer.Process.CREATED, Jaxer.Process.EXEC_BEGUN, Jaxer.Process.WRITE_ENED, and Jaxer.Process.EXEC_ENDED.

(Advanced)

property.name: readBufferSize
property.description:
The size in bytes of the buffer to use when reading from STDOUT and STDERR. By default this is 1024 bytes.

(Advanced)

property.name: args
property.description: The array of arguments to this process.

property.name: async
property.description: If true, the process will be executed asynchronously (without blocking)

property.name: autoDetachIfAsync
property.description: Whether to detach the process (if it's asynchronous) after any writing to STDIN is complete. This is true by default Note that this property is only used by methods like exec and execAsync; you can always just explicitly detach by calling endExec.

property.name: exitStatus
property.description: The exit status (i.e. return code) of the process, if any. For an async process this is null.

property.name: path
property.description: The absolute path to the executable file to execute

property.name: stderr
property.description: How to handle the standard error stream (STDERR) from the process. If this is a string, it read from STDERR as a character stream; otherwise no reading from STDERR is performed. Note that this property is only used by methods like exec and execAsync; you can always just explicitly read from STDERR using readErrString.

property.name: stdin
property.description: How to handle the standard input stream (STDIN) to the process. If this is a string, it is written to STDIN as a character stream; if this is an array, it is written to STDIN as a binary (byte array) stream; otherwise no writing to STDIN is performed. Note that this property is only used by methods like exec and execAsync; you can always just explicitly write to STDIN using writeString or writeBinary.

property.name: stdout
property.description: How to handle the standard output stream (STDOUT) from the process. If this is a string, it read from STDOUT as a character stream; if this is an array, it is read from STDOUT as a binary (byte array) stream; otherwise no reading from STDOUT is performed. Note that this property is only used by methods like exec and execAsync; you can always just explicitly read from STDOUT using readString or readBinary.

property.name: CREATED
property.description: The internal status indicating the process wrapper has been created but no execution has begun

property.name: EXEC_BEGUN
property.description: The internal status indicating the process has begun executing, but any writing to STDIN is not necessarily finished

property.name: EXEC_ENDED
property.description: The internal status indicating the process has finished executing or has been detached (if async)

property.name: WRITE_ENDED
property.description: The internal status indicating the process has begun executing and any writing to STDIN is finished

method.name: beginExec
method.description: Begins execution of the process. Any arguments to this method are treated as arguments to the process; if no arguments are given, and this.args has been set, it will be used instead. You can start to write to STDIN and read from STDOUT and STDERR after you call this method.

method.name: endExec
method.description: Completes the execution of the process (if synchronous) or detaches it (if asynchronous). A running process may be stopped via kill() anytime before endExec() is called.

return-type.description: If the process is synchronous, its exit status (i.e. return code) is returned.

method.name: endWrite
method.description: Closes STDIN for further writing, which may be needed by the process before it can proceed. This is automatically called by reading anything from STDOUT and STDERR and by endExec.

method.name: exec
method.description: Executes the process. The path to the executable file should already have been set when creating the Process or via the path property. The arguments to this method are used as the arguments to the process. By default, the process is executed synchronously (i.e. it blocks), and nothing is written to STDIN nor read from STDOUT or STDERR. To override these defaults, set any of the following properties before calling this: async, stdin, stdout, stderr, and autoDetachIfAsync. If any of these are set they will be used; for stdout and stderr they will be used only if the process is synchronous, in which case they'll be set to STDOUT/STDERR. If the process is asycnhronous and autoDetachIfAsync is false, it will not be detached until it falls out of scope, so you can still read STDOUT or STDERR and kill it until it falls out of scope, at which point it will be detached; otherwise it will be detached immediately (or after any STDIN is written).

return-type.description: If the process is synchronous, its exit status (i.e. return code) is returned.

method.name: execAsync
method.description: Executes the process asynchronously (i.e. without blocking). The path to the executable file should already have been set when creating the Process or via the path property. The arguments to this method are used as the arguments to the process. By default, nothing is written to STDIN, and the process is immediately detached after it is launched. To override these defaults, set stdin and/or autoDetachIfAsync on the process before calling this. If stdin is set, it will be used. If autoDetachIfAsync is not set (or set to the default value of true), the process will be detached immediately after any STDIN is written. If autoDetachIfAsync is set to false, the process will not be detached, so you can still read STDOUT or STDERR and kill it until it falls out of scope, at which point it will be detached.

method.name: kill
method.description: Kills a running process. This can only be called before endExec() has been called.

method.name: readBinary
method.description: Reads the process's STDOUT stream as a byte array.

parameter.name: maxLength
parameter.description: If specified, limits reading of STDOUT to maxLength bytes

return-type.description: The binary value of STDOUT as an array of integers

method.name: readErrString
method.description: Reads the process's STDERR stream as a character string.

parameter.name: maxLength
parameter.description: If specified, limits reading of STDERR to maxLength characters

return-type.description: The string value of STDERR

method.name: readString
method.description: Reads the process's STDOUT stream as a character string.

parameter.name: maxLength
parameter.description: If specified, limits reading of STDOUT to maxLength characters

return-type.description: The string value of STDOUT

method.name: writeBinary
method.description: Writes the given byte array as a binary stream to the process's STDIN

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: The byte array (array of integers)

method.name: writeString
method.description: Writes the given string as a character stream to the process's STDIN.

parameter.name: str
parameter.description: The string to write

method.name: exec
method.description: Executes the process specified by the given absolute path. Any remaining arguments to this function are used as the arguments to the process, except possibly for the last argument if it is an object, in which case it's removed and used to set options. By default, the process is executed synchronously (i.e. it blocks), and nothing is written to STDIN. To override these defaults, pass as a final argument an object containing the properties to be overridden: async, stdin, stdout, stderr, autoDetachIfAsync. If any of these are set they will be used; for stdout and stderr they will be used only if the process is synchronous, in which case their values in your object will be set to STDOUT/STDERR. For a synchronous process, the return value will be the STDOUT of the process, unless you specify stdout in your options object, in which case the return value is the exitStatus; and unless you specify stderr, an error will be thrown if the process's exitStatus is non-zero or if it writes to STDERR. If the process is executed asynchronously and autoDetachIfAsync is false, it will not be detached until it falls out of scope; otherwise it will be detached immediately (or after any STDIN is written).

examples.example:
document.write("The folder contains:\n" + Jaxer.Process.exec("/bin/ls"));

		var opts = {stdin: 'Hello world', stdout: '', stderr: ''};
		var exitStatus = Jaxer.Process.exec("/bin/cat", "-", opts);
		document.write("Finished /bin/cat with status " + exitStatus + ": opts = " + uneval(opts));

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The absolute path of the executable file to execute

return-type.description: For a synchronous process (without having a stdout property in an options object), returns the STDOUT of the process; otherwise does not return anything.

method.name: execAsync
method.description: Asynchronously executes the process specified by the given absolute path (so it does not block). Any remaining arguments to this function are used as the arguments to the process, except possibly for the last argument if it is an object, in which case it's removed and used to set options. By default, nothing is written to STDIN nor read from STDOUT or STDERR, and the process is immediately detached after it is launched. To override these defaults, pass as a final argument an object containing the properties to be overridden: stdin and/or autoDetachIfAsync. If stdin is set, it will be used. If autoDetachIfAsync is not set (or set to the default value of true), the process will be detached immediately after any STDIN is written. If autoDetachIfAsync is set to false, the process will not be detached until it falls out of scope, at which point it will be detached.

examples.example:
Jaxer.Process.execAsync("/bin/sleep", 1, {autoDetachIfAsync: false});
		var opts = {stdout: ''};
		Jaxer.Process.exec('/bin/ps', '-ax', opts);
		print("Sleep is running? " + (Jaxer.Util.String.grep(opts.stdout, "/bin/sleep").length > 0));
		Jaxer.Util.sleep(2000);
		Jaxer.Process.exec('/bin/ps', '-ax', opts);
		print("Sleep is running? " + (Jaxer.Util.String.grep(opts.stdout, "/bin/sleep").length > 0));

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The absolute path of the executable file to execute

class.description: An instance of this object has the lifecycle of the current request and contains information about it.

constructor.description: An instance of this object has the lifecycle of the current request and contains information about it. This constructor is typically never invoked by the user. During the processing of the page Jaxer will create an instance of this object named Jaxer.request, this instance should be used to introspect the request details.

parameter.name: evt
parameter.description: The core event whose data is used to initialize this Request object instance

return-type.description: Returns an instance of Request.

property.name: appKey
property.description:
A string used to identify what application the current request is asking for

(Advanced)

property.name: pageKey
property.description:
A string used to identify what page in the application the current request is asking for

(Advanced)

property.name: action
property.description: The type of HTTP request this is: usually "GET" or "POST". Guaranteed to be all upper-case, and the same as the action property.

property.name: app
property.description: The Jaxer.App object constructed by searching in configApps.js for an object that matches the current request's parsedUrl and using it to set application-specific settings (such as the database connection to use) during this request

property.name: body
property.description: The body of the HTTP request, which usually contains the data during a POST request, and is often of type 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded' (i.e. "name1=value1&name2=value2&..."). The type of data returned by this property depends on the Content-Type of the request and on Config.REQUEST_BODY_AS.

property.name: bodyAsByteArray
property.description: The body of this request (usually the payload of a POST request) as a byte array, which may be empty. For example, a GET request always has an empty body.

property.name: bodyAsStream
property.description: The body of this request (usually the payload of a POST request) as a stream, which may be empty. For example, a GET request always has an empty body.

property.name: bodyAsString
property.description: The body of this request (usually the payload of a POST request) as a string, which may be empty. For example, a GET request always has an empty body. NOTE that when the contentType is 'multipart/form-data' this will always be '', indicating that the body of the request has been pre-processed by Jaxer and is instead available via the files and data properties.

property.name: contentLength
property.description: The Content-Length in bytes of the body of this request. NOTE that when the contentType is 'multipart/form-data' this will always return 0, indicating that the body of the request has been pre-processed by Jaxer and is instead available via the files and data properties.

property.name: contentType
property.description: The Content-Type (i.e. mime-type) of the body of this request, which describes the body of this request. Usually this will be 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded' or 'multipart/form-data'.

property.name: current
property.description: Holds the parsed URL information of the current page, which on a callback is different from the original page.

property.name: currentFolder
property.description: The folder (directory) on disk holding the file (pageFile) being served in this request. This is '' if there is no pageFile information, e.g. if the web server is on a different filesystem than Jaxer.

property.name: data
property.description: An object holding the name=value pairs of the current request's body (assumed to be of type application/x-www-form-urlencoded) as properties

property.name: documentRoot
property.description: The location on disk of the top folder from which all web pages are served by the web server, as an absolute URL (without the preceding file://). This is usually only meaningful if the web server is on the same filesystem as Jaxer.

property.name: env
property.description: A collection of the environment variables received from the web server for this request, as properties on this simple JavaScript object. If multiple variables had the same name, their values are given as an array.

property.name: files
property.description: An array of Jaxer.Request.FileInfo objects describing any uploaded files. You must call save(newFileName) on each of these if you'd like to save them, otherwise they will be purged at the end of the request.

property.name: headers
property.description: A collection of the HTTP headers received from the web server for this request, as properties on this simple JavaScript object. If multiple headers had the same name, their values are given as an array.

property.name: isCallback
property.description: True if Jaxer is handling the current request as a callback (RPC). This requires Jaxer to be the handler of the request and the path of the request to start with Config.CALLBACK_URI (which must not be blank)

property.name: isHandler
property.description: True if Jaxer is the main "handler" for the current request, rather than is filtering a page served by a different handler.

property.name: isHTTPS
property.description: Whether the current page is being requested and served over the HTTPS protocol.

property.name: method
property.description: The type of HTTP request this is: usually "GET" or "POST". Guaranteed to be all upper-case, and the same as the action property.

property.name: pageFile
property.description: The location on disk of the current page's file, served by the web server, as an absolute URL (without the preceding file://). This is usually only meaningful if the web server is on the same filesystem as Jaxer.

property.name: paramIsBody
property.description: True if the entire body of the request is to be considered as the single data parameter of this request.

property.name: parsedUrl
property.description: Holds the parsed URL information of the true page: this is the current URL for a regularly-served page, but for a callback this is the URL of the original page (now the Referer) that requested the callback.

property.name: protocol
property.description: The protocol declared in the HTTP request, e.g. "HTTP/1.1".

property.name: queryString
property.description: The query part of the current request's URL, after the "?". This is also available as Jaxer.request.parsedUrl.query and is parsed into the JavaScript object Jaxer.request.parsedUrl.queryParts.

property.name: referer
property.description: The value of the Referer HTTP header for this request, which should indicate the complete URL of the page that made this request. If this is a callback, the referer is taken from the "callingPage" parameter of the request, only using the Referer header if for some reason "callingPage" is not available.

property.name: remoteAddr
property.description: The Internet Protocol (IP) address of the client (browser) that sent the request.

property.name: remoteHost
property.description: The hostname of the client (browser) that sent the request, or the IP address of the client if the hostname cannot be determined.

property.name: remoteUser
property.description: If the browser making the request submitted HTTP authentication credentials, this is the username submitted. Otherwise it is the empty string.

property.name: uri
property.description: The URL (and URI) of the current request.

property.name: userAgent
property.description: The string used to identify the user agent of the client making the request.

property.name: ACTIONS
property.description: An enumeration of constants for various standard HTTP methods or actions

method.name: compileScript
method.description: Low-level method to compile a string of JavaScript source code in a given global context and with a certain effectiveUrl as its "file".

parameter.name: contents
parameter.description: The string of script code to evaluate

parameter.name: global
parameter.description: An optional global context (usually a window object) in which to evaluate it

parameter.name: effectiveUrl
parameter.description: An optional parameter to indicate (e.g. in error messages) the effective URL from which this code originates.

return-type.description: The compiled code

method.name: evaluateCompiledScript
method.description: Low-level method to evaluate a string of compiled JavaScript code in a given global context.

parameter.name: compiledContents
parameter.description: The bytecode string of script code to evaluate

parameter.name: global
parameter.description: An optional global context (usually a window object) in which to evaluate it

return-type.description: The result of the evaluation, if any

method.name: evaluateScript
method.description: Low-level method to evaluate a string of JavaScript source code in a given global context and with a certain effectiveUrl as its "file".

parameter.name: contents
parameter.description: The string of script code to evaluate

parameter.name: global
parameter.description: An optional global context (usually a window object) in which to evaluate it

parameter.name: effectiveUrl
parameter.description: An optional parameter to indicate (e.g. in error messages) the effective URL from which this code originates.

return-type.description: The result of the evaluation, if any

property.name: DELETE
property.description: A constant describing the standard HTTP DELETE method (or action)

property.name: GET
property.description: A constant describing the standard HTTP GET method (or action)

property.name: HEAD
property.description: A constant describing the standard HTTP HEAD method (or action)

property.name: OPTIONS
property.description: A constant describing the standard HTTP OPTIONS method (or action)

property.name: POST
property.description: A constant describing the standard HTTP POST method (or action)

property.name: PUT
property.description: A constant describing the standard HTTP PUT method (or action)

class.description: Container for information about uploaded files.

constructor.description:
A container for information about uploaded files. The constructor is not meant to be called directly.

(Advanced)

parameter.name: req
parameter.description: The Jaxer Core's request object

parameter.name: i
parameter.description: An index into the list of uploaded files

return-type.description: Returns an instance of FileInfo.

property.name: tempFileName
property.description:
The name under which the file was temporarily saved

(Advanced)

property.name: contentType
property.description: The content type of this file, as reported by the web server

property.name: elementName
property.description: The name of the field as specified in the HTML form

property.name: fileName
property.description: The original name of the file that was actually uploaded from the user's filesystem

property.name: fileSize
property.description: The size of the file contents, in bytes

property.name: index
property.description: An index into the list of uploaded files

property.name: originalFileName
property.description: The original name of the file that was actually uploaded from the user's filesystem

method.name: save
method.description: Save the uploaded file to the given path -- otherwise it will be automatically purged after this request

parameter.name: newFileName
parameter.description: The name (or full path) of the file to which the uploaded file should be saved.

class.description: Current response and its associated information.

constructor.description: An instance of this object has the lifecycle of the current response and contains information about it. This constructor is typically never invoked by the user. During the processing of the page Jaxer will create an instance of this object named Jaxer.response, this instance should be used to introspect and manage the response details.

parameter.name: evt
parameter.description: The Jaxer Core event whose data is used to initialize this Response object instance and to output to the client

return-type.description: Returns an instance of Response.

property.name: earlyExit
property.description:
This will be true when the document processing has been exited before reaching the end of the document, via the exit() method or another method such as redirect() which uses exit() internally. When that happens, some post-processing steps such as callback proxying will be omitted.

(Advanced)

property.name: headers
property.description: A collection of the HTTP response headers that will be returned to the browser, as properties on this simple JavaScript object. If multiple headers have the same name, their values are given as an array. NOTE: some headers are set by the web server after Jaxer is done, and they will not appear here.

property.name: reasonPhrase
property.description: Gets the string description of the HTTP status code for the request

property.name: statusCode
property.description: Gets the integer value of the HTTP status code for the request

method.name: getContents
method.description:
Gets the contents (body) of the response. For regular page requests, this will return null unless setContents has been called, in which case it will return the value set by the last call to setContents. This should only be used for non-binary return types, i.e. it should not be used after calling setContentsBinary or setContentsFile. For callbacks, this should only be called at the very end of callback processing, when the contents have been explicitly set by the Jaxer framework using the setContents method.

(Advanced)

return-type.description: The explicitly-set contents at this time, or null if no explicit contents have been set (so the DOM will be serialized if this is a regular page request).

method.name: getDomTouched
method.description:
Has the DOM possibly been modified in any way?

(Advanced)

return-type.description: true if it has (or might have), false if it could not have been

method.name: getSideEffect
method.description:
Has there been any possible side effect (e.g. database accessed, etc.)?

(Advanced)

return-type.description: true if there has been (or might have been), false if there could not have been

method.name: noteDomTouched
method.description:
Remembers that the DOM has been altered in some way, which ensures that the final response will be the Jaxer-produced one rather than the original document Jaxer received.

(Advanced)

method.name: noteSideEffect
method.description:
Remembers that processing this page has had some side effect, which ensures that the final response will be treated as having been processed by Jaxer, whether or not its contents have been modified.

(Advanced)

method.name: useOriginalContents
method.description:
Once this is called, the contents of the response will be the same as the contents that Jaxer received in this request, i.e. all DOM changes will be discarded. This is ONLY effective for regular requests, not callbacks.

(Advanced)

method.name: addHeader
method.description: Adds an HTTP header to the response. If an existing header with this name exists, this value will be appended -- if you don't want that, just set Jaxer.response.headers [ name ] = value

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the HTTP header

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to use

method.name: exit
method.description: Stops processing the current request's HTML page and JavaScript, and returns this response to the browser via the web server.

parameter.name: statusCode
parameter.description: The HTTP status code to return to the browser: by default it is 200.

parameter.name: contents
parameter.description: The contents to use for the body of the response. If this is null or undefined, and setContents has not been called on this response, the current DOM will be serialized and returned as the response contents. If this is an XMLDocument or an E4X XML object, its string representation will be used, and a Content-Type header of "application/xml" will be returned (unless a Content-Type header was already specified in this response)

parameter.name: reasonPhrase
parameter.description: The text description (e.g. "OK") of the status code. For all the standard status codes this is optional, as the standard description for the status code will be used by default.

method.name: exposeJaxer
method.description: If Jaxer.Config.EXPOSE_JAXER, this sets an "X-Powered-By" header on the response indicating that Jaxer processing has occurred and noting the build number.

method.name: getError
method.description: Gets the error, if any, of which the framework has been notified during the handling of this request and generation of this response.

method.name: getOverriddenClientFramework
method.description: Gets the parameters of the alternate client framework that will be injected into this response, if the default client framework has been overridden using setClientFramework().

return-type.description: A JavaScript object with properties isSrc (Boolean indicating whether the value is the src or the contents of the script block to be injected) and value (the src or the contents).

method.name: hasError
method.description: Has the framework been notified of an error during the handling of this request and generation of this response?

return-type.description: True if an error was submitted.

method.name: isClientFrameworkOverridden
method.description: Checks whether the client framework has been overridden for this response, i.e. whether setClientFramework has been called.

return-type.description: true if the client framework is overridden, false otherwise

method.name: notifyError
method.description: Notifies the framework that an error has occurred during the handling of this request and generation of this response. How this is handled is then determined by the Jaxer.Config settings.

parameter.name: newError
parameter.description: The error describing what happened. If the framework has already been notified of an error during the current request, this newError is not used.

parameter.name: avoidLogging
parameter.description: If this evaluates to true, an error message will not be logged during this call. Note that if an error message has been logged already in this request, another message will not be logged in any case.

method.name: notifyErrorShown
method.description: Notifies the framework that an error has already been reported in the output page so it need not be reported in the output page again.

method.name: redirect
method.description: Stops processing the current request's HTML page and JavaScript, and returns a redirect-type HTTP response to the browser. No contents (response body) are returned to the browser, and the DOM is not serialized.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: The URL to which the browser should redirect the request. This is mandatory unless the Location header has already been set for this response.

parameter.name: statusCode
parameter.description: The HTTP status code to return to the browser: by default it is 307 (temporary redirect).

parameter.name: reasonPhrase
parameter.description: The text description of the status code. For all the standard status codes this is optional, as the standard description for the status code will be used by default.

method.name: removeHeader
method.description: Removes an HTTP header with a specific value from the response. If there is no such name-value pair, it does nothing. If an existing header with this name exists and has multiple values, this value will be removed -- if you don't want that, just delete Jaxer.response.headers [ name ]

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the HTTP header

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to remove

method.name: resetClientFramework
method.description: Restores the use of the default client framework (using the Jaxer.Config settings), undoing any previous calls to setClientFramework().

method.name: setClientFramework
method.description: Overrides the automatic injection of the client framework into the response page. If neither src nor contents are given, then NO client framework is injected into the page. Make sure you do not rely (implicitly or explicitly) on the presence of the default Jaxer client framework if you call this method!

parameter.name: src
parameter.description: The url of the alternate client framework to use, if any. If this src argument is given, any contents argument will not be used.

parameter.name: contents
parameter.description: The contents of the script block to use as an alternate client framework. If a src argument is specified, the contents argument will not be used.

method.name: setContents
method.description: Sets the contents (body) of the response. Once the response's contents are set this way, the DOM is no longer serialized into the response contents at the end of page processing.

parameter.name: contents
parameter.description: The contents to use for the body of the response. If this is an XMLDocument or an E4X XML object, its string representation will be used, and a Content-Type header of "application/xml" will be returned; if this is another type of object, its JSON representation will be used, and a Content-Type header of "application/json" will be returned; otherwise the contents will be the String() of the passed-in value with no Content-Type impact. Note if a Content-Type header was already specified in this response, that will not be changed in any case.

parameter.name: statusCode
parameter.description: The integer value of the HTTP status code to return. If 0 or null or not specified, it is not set.

parameter.name: reasonPhrase
parameter.description: The string description of the HTTP status code to return. If the statusCode is 0 or null or not specified, the reasonPhrase is not set. Otherwise it defaults to the standard reason phrase for the statusCode ("OK" for 200)

method.name: setContentsBinary
method.description: Sets the contents (body) of the response to the given binary (byte array) data. Once the response's contents are set this way, the DOM is no longer serialized into the response contents at the end of page processing.

examples.example:
// If the image is in your current folder rather than the default file location:
			var path = Jaxer.Dir.resolve("image.png", Jaxer.request.currentFolder);
			var file = new Jaxer.File(path);
			file.open('rb');
			var contents = file.read();
			file.close();
			Jaxer.response.setContentsBinary(contents, "image/png");

parameter.name: contents
parameter.description: The contents to use for the body of the response. It should be an array of numbers between 0 and 255, to be treated as a byte array. The data should be appropriate for the Content-Type header used in this response.

parameter.name: contentType
parameter.description: The Content-Type to be used for this response. If this is not specified or is null, a Content-Type should be set separately.

parameter.name: statusCode
parameter.description: The integer value of the HTTP status code to return. If 0 or null or not specified, it is not set.

parameter.name: reasonPhrase
parameter.description: The string description of the HTTP status code to return. If the statusCode is 0 or null or not specified, the reasonPhrase is not set. Otherwise it defaults to the standard reason phrase for the statusCode ("OK" for 200)

method.name: setContentsFile
method.description: Sets the contents (body) of the response to the given file. The file's contents will be streamed directly back to the web server, chunk by chunk via the socket to the web server, without going through the Jaxer JavaScript framework. Once the response's contents are set this way, the DOM is no longer serialized into the response contents at the end of page processing.

examples.example:
// If the image is in your current folder rather than the default file location:
			var path = Jaxer.Dir.resolve("image.png", Jaxer.request.currentFolder);
			Jaxer.response.setContentsFile(path, "image/png");

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The path to the file on disk. The file should be appropriate for the Content-Type header used in this response.

parameter.name: contentType
parameter.description: The Content-Type to be used for this response. If this is not specified or is null, it will be set from Jaxer.File.mimeType(path), unless that too returns a null. If so, then a Content-Type should be set separately.

parameter.name: statusCode
parameter.description: The integer value of the HTTP status code to return. If 0 or null or not specified, it is not set.

parameter.name: reasonPhrase
parameter.description: The string description of the HTTP status code to return. If the statusCode is 0 or null or not specified, the reasonPhrase is not set. Otherwise it defaults to the standard reason phrase for the statusCode ("OK" for 200)

method.name: setNoCacheHeaders
method.description: Sets headers on this response to mark it as a dynamic one and avoid its being cached. This will always be called by the framework during callback processing. For regular (non-callback) requests, this will only be called by the framework if the DOM has been changed or a side-effect has (or could have) occurred during the processing of this request and the generation of the response.

method.name: setStatus
method.description: Sets the HTTP status code and reason phrase for the response. By default

parameter.name: statusCode
parameter.description: The integer value of the HTTP status code. Defaults to 200

parameter.name: reasonPhrase
parameter.description: The string description of the HTTP status code. Defaults to the standard reason phrase for the statusCode ("OK" for 200)

method.name: statusCodeToReasonPhrase
method.description: Returns the standard W3C reason phrase for the given standard status code. For example, passing in 200 returns "OK", and passing in 404 returns "Not Found".

parameter.name: statusCode
parameter.description: The status code, as an integer (or a string that can be parsed to an integer). If this is not a recognized status code, "Unknown Status Code" is returned.

method.name: wasErrorShown
method.description: True if an error has already been reported in the output page so it need not be reported in the output page again.

return-type.description: True if notifyErrorShown() was called in this response, false otherwise.

class.description: The Class describing a Sandbox: a container that can load a server-side window with its own DOM, and executes JavaScript server-side, but is more protected than the regular Jaxer server-side window.

constructor.description: The constructor of a Sandbox: a container that can load a server-side window with its own DOM, and executes JavaScript server-side, but is more protected than the regular Jaxer server-side window.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: The url to load. If no url is given, nothing is loaded -- you can later use the load method to load it.

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: To GET a page from the url, leave this parameter undefined or pass in null. To POST to the url, set this parameter to the data to be POSTed. It may be a string (usually of the form name1=value&name2=value), or an object whose name->value property pairs will be used to construct such a string.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: A JavaScript object (hashmap) of name: value property pairs specifying how to load this Sandbox.

return-type.description: Returns an instance of Jaxer.Sandbox

property.name: document
property.description: Returns the DOM document that's been loaded into this sandbox's window, or null if a url has not been loaded yet.

property.name: method
property.description: Returns the HTTP method (action) of the request to fetch this Sandbox's URL, e.g. 'GET' ir 'POST'

property.name: readyState
property.description:
Returns the loading state of the window in the Sandbox. The possible values are:
  • 0 UNINITIALIZED -- the contents have not been set or the url has not been loaded
  • 1 LOADING -- the contents are being set or the url is being loaded
  • 2 LOADED -- the contents have been set or the url has been loaded
  • 3 INTERACTIVE -- all network operations have completed
  • 4 COMPLETED -- all operations have completed

property.name: requestHeaders
property.description: Returns the HTTP headers of the request to fetch this Sandbox's URL as properties on the returned object

property.name: status
property.description: Returns the HTTP status of the response to the request to fetch this Sandbox's URL, e.g. 200 (i.e. OK)

property.name: statusText
property.description: Returns the HTTP status text of the response to the request to fetch this Sandbox's URL, e.g. 'OK' (for a status of 200)

property.name: window
property.description: Returns the window that's been loaded into this sandbox, or null if a url has not been loaded yet.

property.name: defaults
property.description: The default OpenOptions which new calls to new Jaxer.Sandbox() or Jaxer.Web.load() will use, unless overridden by the options argument.

method.name: close
method.description: Closes the Sandbox's window, which terminates any async loading and removes the window and its document. This call is usually optional, since the window and its document are automatically removed at the end of the Jaxer request, and they are safely reused if you open (load) the same Sandbox more than once. It's therefore mostly useful for stopping open async requests.

method.name: open
method.description: Opens the sandbox's window and document by creating them (if needed) and then loading a url into them, via a GET or POST request. You usually do not need to explicitly close() this, except to cancel async requests.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: The url to load from

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: To GET a page from the url, leave this parameter undefined or pass in null. To POST to the url, set this parameter to the data to be POSTed. It may be a string (usually of the form name1=value&name2=value), or an object whose name->value property pairs will be used to construct such a string.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: A JavaScript object (hashmap) of name: value property pairs specifying how to load this Sandbox.

method.name: responseHeaders
method.description: Returns the HTTP headers of the response to the request to fetch this Sandbox's URL as properties on the returned object

method.name: setContents
method.description: Loads the sandbox's window and document from a string by creating them (if needed) and then loading the string into them. You do not need to explicitly close() this.

parameter.name: contents
parameter.description: The contents to load into the window, usually an HTML string. If a DOM node or document are used, they are converted to HTML, and if an object is passed in its toString() is used.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: A JavaScript object (hashmap) of name: value property pairs specifying how to load this Sandbox.

method.name: toHTML
method.description: Returns the HTML of the given node in the Sandbox's DOM, or of the entire Sandbox's document DOM. If the Sandbox has not yet been loaded from a url, returns an empty string ('').

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: The HTML element or document (or DOM node) to be serialized. By default the entire Sandbox document is used.

return-type.description: The complete HTML representation of the node or document and its contents, or '' if the Sandbox has no document

method.name: waitForCompletion
method.description: Waits for the Sandbox's window to complete loading, allowing asynchronous processing of events to continue, up to a maximum number of milliseconds (if specified).

parameter.name: maxMillis
parameter.description: The number of milliseconds to wait for the sandbox to complete loading before timing out and exiting. If this is zero or negative, waits indefinitely (though other timeouts may intervene).

return-type.description: Returns true if the Sandbox window loaded successfully (or was never initialized), false if the timeout occurred before that.

class.description: Options used to define the behavior of Jaxer.Sandbox opening.

constructor.description: Options used to define the behavior of Jaxer.Sandbox loading. Create a new Jaxer.Sandbox loading() to get the default options, then modify its properties as needed before passing it to new Jaxer.Sandbox() or to load() on an instance of Jaxer.Sandbox.

return-type.description: Returns an instance of OpenOptions.

property.name: allowJavaScript
property.description: Whether to allow (server-side) execution of JavaScript, if any, within the loaded page. By default, this is true. This applies to JavaScript in the page inside this Sandbox instance, not the JavaScript of the loading page. Note that the JavaScript inside this Sandbox instance in any case does not have access to the Jaxer framework, and is running without the usual Jaxer server-side privileges.

property.name: allowMetaRedirects
property.description: Whether to allow refresh-based redirects within the loaded page. By default, this is true;

property.name: allowSubFrames
property.description: Whether to allow the loaded page to itself load frames or iframes. By default, this is true.

property.name: async
property.description: Set to true for asynchronous, false for synchronous (default). To use it asynchronously, see also Jaxer.Thread.waitFor.

property.name: headers
property.description: Add name-value pairs to this object to set headers on the http request. Both the name and the value should be strings. For POST requests, a 'Content-Type' header with value "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" will be added automatically unless you specify a different one, and a 'Content-Length' header with the appropriate value will also be set.

property.name: onload
property.description: The value of this, if any, will be used as the Sandbox's onload handler. The onload handler will be called after the page is loaded, and after the page's own onload is invoked, if any. It's particularly useful when the page is loaded asynchronously, in which case it may be used in conjunction with the Sandbox's waitForCompletion method or with Jaxer.Thread.waitFor.

property.name: onlocationchange
property.description:
Set this to an event handler function you want called if the document in the Sandbox redirects (changes its location). This will happen whether the redirect is due to an HTTP status code or header (e.g. the web server returned a 307 Temporary Redirect and a Location header), or it is in the HTML either as a meta element with a HTTP-Equiv attribute or a JavaScript action (e.g. window.location = ...).

The function will be called with two arguments:
  1. the new url to which the location would be changed,
  2. and a boolean flag that will be true if it's an HTTP status+location redirect and false if it's a location change due to HTML or JavaScript.


If the function returns a true, the redirection is allowed; if it returns a false the location is not changed.

property.name: onsslcerterror
property.description:
Set to a custom callback function to call if an SSL request fails due to a certificate error.

The function will be called with the following arguments:
  1. the certInfo (an object containing properties describing the certificate and its status),
  2. the cert (certificate) itself (an object containing properties describing the certificate and its status),
  3. the XHR's socketInfo
  4. the XHR's sslStatus
  5. the XHR's targetSite


It should return true to ignore the error, or false to abort the request. This is only available server-side. If (and only if) this is set to a function that returns true, information about the failure can be retrieved from the extended response's certInfo property.

class.description: Container object used during runat attribute and property processing.

constructor.description:
This is a container object used during runat attribute and property processing. This allows all runat-related state to be passed around in one simple container object. At the same time, this formalizes what is being passed around which is preferable to using a simple anonymous object.

(Advanced)

return-type.description: Returns an instance of ScriptInfo.

class.description: This class processes script elements to determine which of its functions fall into the various runat categories.

constructor.description:
This class processes script elements to determine which of its functions fall into the various runat categories. This class collects each function into its appropriate category and provides convenience functions to generate the necessary source code for this block needed for both client-side and server-side use.

(Advanced)

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The underlying script element to be processed by this class

parameter.name: jaxerProxies
